stories.text: Over the past, say, 5 years I’ve seen so many headlines about honeybee populations in decline around the world, along with gloomy forecasts of what that means for ecosystems etc. Then I read an article in the most recent Economist that mentions, in passing, that that’s a myth. Which of these is true? And maybe more importantly, if honeybee populations are not in decline, what accounts for the persistence of the myth?
stories.title: Are honeybee populations declining or not?
The Year in Math and Computer Science
Everything you need to know about pointers in C

stories.text:
Hi all,

I've been hiking in areas with many trail splits and low/missing signage recently and my phone & ham radio GPS has been handy. However the app I'm using doesn't seem to have a path-retracing feature, which would be really nice since lots of trails lead back, but only some are not "dramatic" trails.

I'm looking for a FOSS Android app solution if possible. Any recommendations appreciated.
stories.title: Ask HN: Any FOSS Android apps allowing GPS path retrace?
